cluster_relations.rel_desc: Grave goods are intended to provide comfort to the deceased in the afterlife.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: if the deceased reaches the afterlife

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Grave goods are also intended to provide sustenance to the deceased in the afterlife.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: for the deceased in the afterlife

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Grave goods are conceived as items to be used by the deceased in the afterlife.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Food offerings are meant as provisions for the deceased in the afterlife.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Tools are envisioned as items the deceased would use in the afterlife.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is intended to provide a specific benefit or provision (here, to the deceased) in the context of the afterlife.
args.justification: Both relations describe grave goods whose intended purpose is to provide some benefit (comfort or sustenance) to the deceased in the afterlife; the core predicate is an intention to provide a benefit, regardless of the specific type of benefit.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is intended to be used in or within a particular context or realm (here, by the deceased in the afterlife).
args.justification: These three relations describe items (grave goods, food offerings, tools) whose purpose is to be used by the deceased in the afterlife; the shared semantics is an intended use within a specific context (the afterlife realm).

All five relations connect funerary goods or offerings to aspects of the deceased's existence in the afterlife, describing how these items are meant to provide for or be used by the deceased there; grouping them under an 'afterlife_provision_relation' class captures this shared conceptual family.

Each relation expresses an intended function or use of objects (grave goods, tools, offerings) in relation to the deceased's afterlife, which fits a broad USAGE-oriented group (intended use and functional purpose) better than composition or identity.

executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe grave goods whose intended purpose is to provide some benefit (comfort or sustenance) to the deceased in the afterlife; the core predicate is an intention to provide a benefit, regardless of the specific type of benefit.

executed_decisions.justification: These three relations describe items (grave goods, food offerings, tools) whose purpose is to be used by the deceased in the afterlife; the shared semantics is an intended use within a specific context (the afterlife realm).

All five relations connect funerary goods or offerings to aspects of the deceased's existence in the afterlife, describing how these items are meant to provide for or be used by the deceased there; grouping them under an 'afterlife_provision_relation' class captures this shared conceptual family.
